metadata.title: CVE-2019-18805 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS-updates 18.04 LTS (bionic) - low
metadata.description:
An issue was discovered in net/ipv4/sysctl_net_ipv4.c in the Linux kernelbefore 5.0.11. There is a net/ipv4/tcp_input.c signed integer overflow intcp_ack_update_rtt() when userspace writes a very large integer to/proc/sys/net/ipv4/tcp_min_rtt_wlen, leading to a denial of service orpossibly unspecified other impact, aka CID-19fad20d15a6.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-18805` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.15.0-60-generic - 4.15.0-60.67
linux-image-4.15.0-60-generic-lpae - 4.15.0-60.67
linux-image-4.15.0-60-lowlatency - 4.15.0-60.67
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-60-generic - 4.15.0-60.67
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-60-lowlatency - 4.15.0-60.67
No subscription required

linux-image-5.0.0-23-generic - 5.0.0-23.24~18.04.1
